definition:
Let $X$ be a topological space and $p,q$ paths in $X$ with the same
initial point $x_{0}$ and terminal point $x_{1}$. If there exists a
continuous function $F: I \times I \to X$ such that

1.  $F(s,0)=p(s)$ for all $s \in I$

2.  $F(s,1)=q(s)$ for all $s \in I$

3.  $F(0,t)=x_{0}$ for all $t \in I$

4.  $F(1,t)=x_{1}$ for all $t \in I$

we call $F$ a *homotopy of paths* in $X$ and say $p,q$ are *homotopic
paths* in $X$. $F$ is also called a *continuous deformation*.
